title.narrative: GUY1.1 ACCESS TO DATA AND ANALYSIS

description.narrative: Policy makers have increased access to disaggregated data available periodically and enact equity based national policies and legislations in fulfilment of Guyana's child rights obligations, which contributes to Cross-Sectoral Monitoring, Data And Situation Analyses, Human Rights Institutions, Other Cross-Sectoral Programme Areas, Policy Advocacy â€“ Urban, Civil Society, Parliament, Environment, Social Protection, Social Protection And Child Poverty. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Evaluations, Research And Data, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2016, Governments of Guyana and Suriname have in place systems for continuous monitoring of the situation for boys, girls, and women in the general population and in the hinterland and rural areas of Guyana and the interior of Suriname based on reliable disaggregated data and are using the data to formulate and continuously update equity-and gender-sensitive national and sub- national plans to guide continuing progress in the survival, development, protection and participation of children and women at the aggregated level and among disadvantaged groups based on CRC and CEDAW.

sector.narrative: Administrative data, registers and non-MICS household surveys and censuses
CRC, CEDAW or CRPD - follow up on concluding observations

Cash Transfers: Technical support to government cash transfer system development and expansion (design, targeting, beneficiary selection, grievance mechanism, cash delivery mechanisms like banking, mobiles, community distribution)
Child marriage - surveys (e.g. KAP, VACS), data analysis/research/evaluation evidence generation, synthesis, and use
Country programme process (including UNDAF planning and CCA)
ECD data, evidence, and knowledge generation and dissemination
Situation Analysis or Update on women and children
Social and behaviour change communication on violence, exploitation and abuse
Social protection and welfare services policy, planning and administration
Stimulating demand for and capacity to use data

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Policy makers have increased access to disaggregated data available periodically and enact equity based national policies andlegislations in fulfilment of Guyana?s child rights obligations

description.narrative: MICS 5 and the Situation Analysis of Women and Children in Guyana were launched in 2016, and provide important information the country will use to make future plans | Status:Met | As-of Date:11/01/2017

title.narrative: Updated comprehensive situation assessment and analysis of children and women in Guyana

actual.value: 2015:The final report on the Situation Analysis on children and women was finalized and approved in August 2016

title.narrative: Bureau of Statistics has the capacity to collect statistical data disaggregated (by sex, age, region, ethnicity, income ) on key indicators for children and women

baseline.value: Gaps in statistical standards, tools and technical capacity

actual.value: 2015:Capacity building was conducted through, MICS data processing, data analysis, interpretation and dissemination and GuyD_Info utilisation and ToT workshops. Consensus reachd on a 2nd generation needs based comprehensive capacity strengthening plan

title.narrative: GuyD_Info database having up to date available disaggregated(by sex, age, region, ethnicity, income) data on key indicators for children and women

target.value: 2016:Data released available in GuyD_Info within 3 months

actual.value: 2015:The final report for Guyana population and housing Census was expected to be published in 2014 but is now scheduled to be published by the end of 2015. The preliminary Census report was published in June of this year

title.narrative: National household survey or DHS or MICS providing key indicators on the situation of women and children conducted at least every 3 years

target.value: 2016:MICS 5 results available and at least one survey not older than five years available

actual.value: 2015:The Demographic and Health Survey comes to the five-year age at the end of 2014, when the key findings report for the MICS is be being finalised

title.narrative: MICS 5 providing disaggregated data on child rights (survival, education, protection, participation) indicators

baseline.value: MICS3 2006 report provides data on key indicators, mostly disaggregated.

target.value: 2016:Increased availability of additional monitoring indicators disaggregated by sex, age, region, ethnicity, and income as relevant

actual.value: 2015:Fieldwork, data entry and processing have been completed in the implementation of MICS 5. The key findings report was finalised Dec 2014 and will be published in Jan 2015. The final report is expected to be completed and published by March 2015

title.narrative: Guyana Children's Rights Monitoring System providing data for Caribbean sub-regional M&E system.

target.value: 2016:Child Right Monitoring Indicators available from GuyD_Info

actual.value: 2015:The RFAFC finalised and a monitoring system, which is extendable, was established and operationalized. Classification for Outcome level indicators should be reflected in the CARICOM DevInfo database currently being compiled. Indicator dropped at the MTR.

title.narrative: Guyana Rights of the Child Commission issuing annual status report and recommendations, compliant with the CRC and its optional protocols

baseline.value: No monitoring system in place, no annual report available

actual.value: 2015:The statutory report for RCC will be submitted in 2015. However, this will now be constrained due to the Parliamentary suspension

title.narrative: Agreement on development of Post-MDG/2015 action Plans on Children and Women reached

target.value: 2016:Agreement reached by 2014 on sectors requiring post MDG 2015 plans

title.narrative: (NOT VALID after Dec 31 2017) ) Existence of advocacy and engagement to place child poverty as a national priority

target.value: 2016:Child poverty prioritised by MSDF and CPD 2017-2021

actual.value: 2017:Child Poverty is clearly spelled out in one of the CPD's outputs. The government is fully committed to work in this area in the years to come as part of the new cooperation agreement.

title.narrative: Plan of Action to implement CRC and CEDAW recommendations and recommendation of the UN Study on violence against children completed and under implementation

target.value: 2016:Action plan to address CRC recommendation available by 2014 and implementation monitored

actual.value: 2015:Progress has been made in determining the next steps and hiring a consultant. The action plan will be developed in 2015 with the support of line Ministries.
